hero.headline: Critical RCE Vulnerability in React Server Components - Patch Now
hero.summary: A critical remote code execution vulnerability (GHSA-9qr9-h5gf-34mp) has been discovered in React and Next.js Server Components. The flaw allows attackers to execute arbitrary code on servers running RSC. Security researchers are urging all developers using React Server Components to update immediately.
hero.whyItMatters: This affects a massive portion of the modern web stack. If you're running Next.js with the App Router or any React Server Components in production, you need to patch today. The vulnerability is in the core RSC architecture, not a dependency—making it especially critical.

topStories.title: Critical RCE Vulnerability in React Server Components (GHSA-9qr9-h5gf-34mp)
topStories.summary: A critical remote code execution vulnerability has been discovered in React and Next.js server components. The security advisory affects applications using React Server Components and requires immediate patching. Security researchers urge developers to update immediately.

topStories.title: OpenAI Codex CLI Supply Chain Vulnerability Patched (v0.23.0)
topStories.summary: Check Point Research discovered a critical flaw in how Codex CLI handles project configurations—a malicious .env file could silently execute commands when developers clone and run repositories. OpenAI patched the vulnerability, but the attack vector highlights risks in AI coding tools.

topStories.title: Claude for Nonprofits Launches with 75% Discounts
topStories.summary: Anthropic launched Claude for Nonprofits on GivingTuesday, offering up to 75% off Team and Enterprise plans for mission-driven organizations globally. The program aims to democratize AI access for nonprofits working on social impact.

topStories.title: GELab-Zero: Step.fun Releases State-of-the-Art GUI Agent
topStories.summary: Step.fun's GUI Exploration Lab offers one of the best open-source GUI agent solutions, enabling AI to interact with graphical interfaces and mobile applications. As agentic AI matures, GUI automation becomes critical for real-world task execution.

trendingSkills.name: security-scanner
trendingSkills.description: Scans codebases for security vulnerabilities and potential risks. Essential for security-conscious development workflows.

trendingSkills.name: code-duplication-detector
trendingSkills.description: Identifies and flags duplicate code patterns within projects. Helps maintain DRY principles and reduce technical debt.

trendingSkills.name: dependency-tracker
trendingSkills.description: Monitors and manages project dependencies and their relationships. Helps identify outdated or vulnerable packages.

trendingSkills.name: best-practices-checker

AI News: Here's What We'll Get from AI in 2025

highlights: Pro subscribers can now use Opus 4.5 as part of their subscription plan
Added feedback input when rejecting plans, allowing users to tell Claude what to change
VSCode now displays Claude Code in secondary sidebar while keeping file explorer accessible
New hooks system for tool execution, LLM requests/responses, and agent lifecycle integration
Session browser with /resume slash command for continuing previous sessions
MCP server instructions support behind config option for improved integration
Enhanced threads with git info and metadata propagation for better context
Windows protections that flag risky browser or URL launches
Shell-tool MCP login support and expanded MCP tooling capabilities

notableQuotes.quote: Prompt engineering is very much alive—and more important than ever. It's become more critical as companies rely on LLMs to drive user-facing features and core functionality. Prompt quality can make or break AI performance—especially when scaled across products.
notableQuotes.author: Sander Schulhoff

notableQuotes.quote: A single malicious file could compromise an entire development environment. The patch prevents .env files from silently redirecting the CODEX_HOME variable into project directories, closing the automatic execution path.
notableQuotes.author: Check Point Research

notableQuotes.quote: Developers using byLLM completed tasks over three times faster and wrote 45% fewer lines of code. The framework eliminates manual prompt engineering by integrating LLMs directly into existing software with a single line of code.
notableQuotes.author: SPLASH Conference Researchers

prompt: Generate AI news digest by fetching aggregated feed, searching for Claude Code/Gemini CLI/OpenAI Codex news, fetching changelogs, SkillsMP skills, MCP servers, and compiling into structured JSON with hero story, top stories, trending repos, tool updates, and notable quotes for prompt engineering audience.
